i suppose someone else would have notice: Yeah, the default sources.list is a bit verbose.
Please pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list
http://pastebin.com/4FQJpH8x
There are no lucid-security sources there.
Enable security updates in System->Administration->Software Sources.
deb http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu lucid-updates main restricted universe multiverse
lucid-updates != lucid-security
Security updates are copied to updates later, but they won't show up as security updates.
thanks, that fixed it alright
Don't worry -- updates are copied from -security to -updates an hour or two after they are published, so you won't be behind much.
that quick? why?
where can i read more?
Because security.ubuntu.com isn't mirrored.
So we copy it onto the mirrors as quickly as possible.
i thought that was a "security feature" ?
Every Ubuntu machine points at security.ubuntu.com so they know about security updates ASAP, even if their mirror is slow to update.
But most machines point at up-to-date mirrors, so they'll download from there instead.
This is what stops the security.ubuntu.com DC from melting :)
is it possible that new installs don't include security by default, or is it more likely i clobbered my sources.list ?
anyhow thanks for your help
